com.example.sip
Class MapSchoolResultActivity

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
                      com.example.sip.MapSchoolResultActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
public class MapSchoolResultActivity
extends android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

This activity contains information for the screen that is responsible to show on a google map the results(schools) which the user has selected before in SchoolListActivity. Schools are shown as markers and boroughs as polygons. Schools are coloured according the gcse results and boroughs according the unemployment rate.

Author:
Loucas Stylianou

Constructor Detail

MapSchoolResultActivity

public MapSchoolResultActivity()
Method Detail

addMarker

public void addMarker(int index,
                      float color)
This method is responsible to create and add markers on the map. Markers are used to show schools location.

Parameters:
index - The location of the school object in the schoolList. Used to retrieve school's name and coordinates.
color - The colour that the marker should have according to the given criteria.

addPolygon

public void addPolygon(int index,
                       int color)
This method is responsible to create polygons according to the given parameters.

Parameters:
index - Location of the borough in the BoroughSore.
color - The colour that the polygon should be drawn with.

connectWidgets

private void connectWidgets()
This method connects android widgets found in the map_result_activity.xml file with this class corresponding fields. Also initialises map object and calls the SupportMapFragment in order to make it compatible with older versions of android apis.

getBoroughFillColor

private int getBoroughFillColor(float unemploymentRate)
This method is used to get the needed colour for the polygons (boroughs) according to their unemployment rate.

Parameters:
unemploymentRate - The unemployment rate of the borough.
Returns:
The colour that should be used for the setFillColor of a polygon

onCreate

protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
When this activity is created, schools are shown in the form of markers on the map but first the user should press show markers to see them. Also polygon (boroughs' boundaries) are drawn on the map according to some criteria.

Overrides:
onCreate in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

onResume

public void onResume()
When the activity is running the user could click on the button show markers to see the markers on the map and the same button to hide markers of the map. Also the user has the ability to click on a marker info window and then a dialog box appears containing information for the specific school.

Overrides:
onResume in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
